Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery lid; beige-brown clay, some mica and some angular calcareous and other (stone) inclusions, hard fired. Worn white slip on outside. Inside reserved. Maeander frieze on rim. Lotus and bud frieze on outside of dome; band of mixed rectangular motifs to the inside; added red dots on central petal of lotus flower and on each side of lotus bud; to the centre, small part of main frieze preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'KLAZ' in Greek letters written in pencil on inside.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.388)
